Putting all together:

The C program would look like this:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    char first_line[100];
    fgets(first_line, sizeof(first_line), stdin);
    char *first_token = strtok(first_line, " ");

    char second_line[100];
    fgets(second_line, sizeof(second_line), stdin);
    int a, b;
    sscanf(second_line, "%d %d", &a, &b);

    char u[100];
    fgets(u, sizeof(u), stdin);
    u[strcspn(u, "\n")] = 0; // remove newline

    int x, y;
    if (strcmp(u, first_token) == 0) {
        x = a - 1;
        y = b;
    } else {
        x = a;
        y = b - 1;
    }

    int n = x;
    long long ans = 0;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        int k = n / i;
        ans += ( ( (long long)i * k ) * (k + 1) ) / 2;
    }

    printf("%lld\n", ans);

    return 0;
}

Wait, but need to make sure that the first_token is properly handled. The first_line may have leading or trailing spaces, but strtok splits on any whitespace. So first_token is the first token of the first line.

Also, the u string may have a newline at the end, which is removed via the strcspn line.
